conclusion: Analyze the motion of particles in the velocity selector to solve the problem.
Determine the electric field strength E in the velocity selector: E = vB.
The first particle has mass m and charge q, passing through the velocity selector with velocity v.
The kinetic energy of the first particle is E_{k1} = (1/2)mv^2.
The second particle has mass 2m and charge q, departing from the velocity selector with deviation d.
The radius of the circular path of the second particle in the magnetic field is r = mv/(qB).
The deviation d is due to the difference in forces, and the distance traveled in the electric field is d = qdB^2/(4mv).
Solving for v, we get v = qdB/(2m).
The kinetic energy of the second particle is E_{k2} = q^2d^2B^2/(4m).
The ratio of the kinetic energies is E_{k2}/E_{k1} = 2.
The kinetic energy of the second particle is E_{k2} = 2E_{k1}.
Final answer: The kinetic energy of the second particle when it leaves the velocity selector is q^2d^2B^2/(4m).
